page.title: 19ASIAN COMMUNITY,BOLTON
page.content: We interviewed a nursery nurse who has lived in Bolton all her life. First she lived in Park Road and now she lives in Cross Ormrad Street. Her father moved to Bolton 22 years ago to work in the then prosperous cotton mills of Bolton. Her mother moved here twenty years ago and she speaks Gujarati,Hindi and English. Her father moved from Burmah so he can speak Burmese,Gujarati,Urdu and English. She worked at Pikes Lane School because she realised the need for a nursery nurse as 90% of the children were Asians . The area on the opposite side of the railway line is mostly occupied by Asians or Indians who have formed a kind of community.There is a mosque where she lives and she thinks that is why a lot of Asians live there.
